channel.title: JMDB - Music database writer
channel.description:
Well, today I got bored and felt like making an organized database of my music. I ended up using http://javamusictag.sourceforge.net/, a open-source Java utility that parses ID3 tags from MP3 files to grab information of multiple files in a directory and add it to various arrays. After that, the program outputs and XML of all information in the arrays. Example: [code] [user@COSMOS JMDB]$ ls bin Dominate.mp3 Downbeat clique.mp3 Sabbath Bloody Sabbath.mp3 src [/code] After execution: [code] [user@COSMOS JMDB]$ ls bin database.xml Dominate.mp3 Downbeat clique.mp3 Sabbath Bloody Sabbath.mp3 src [/code] Contents of database.xml:
Morbid Angel Dominate Domination Dominate.mp3 Napalm Death Downbeat clique Time Waits For No Slave Downbeat clique.mp3 Anthrax Sabbath Bloody Sabbath I'm The Man [Ep] Sabbath Bloody Sabbath.mp3
Of course, items can be added to the database without re-writing it.

item.title: JMDB - Music database writer
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:10, topic:283407”][quote author=T4_ link=topic=374514.msg2825101#msg2825101 date=1244917303]

Neat idea. How are paths and folders handled? (if at all?)

Just change the strings inside of the Config class. Can use any path you’d like:

C:\\path\\to\\my\\crap
/home/user/music

. (local directory)
[/quote]

What I meant was, assuming it could recurse through multiple folders, or even support multiple folders, are the paths absolute or relative (the difference between /home/mopar/somefile and somefile). But I guess it just does one folder.[/quote]
Yes, one folder at the moment.

Read full topic

item.title: JMDB - Music database writer
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“T4_, post:6, topic:283407”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=374514.msg2824830#msg2824830 date=1244889805]
Neat idea. How are paths and folders handled? (if at all?)
[/quote]
Just change the strings inside of the Config class. Can use any path you’d like:

C:\\path\\to\\my\\crap
/home/user/music
.

What I meant was, assuming it could recurse through multiple folders, or even support multiple folders, are the paths absolute or relative (the difference between /home/mopar/somefile and somefile). But I guess it just does one folder.

Read full topic

Nice one if you ask me

Read full topic

item.title: JMDB - Music database writer
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

eczema3:

Imo it would be better using a playlist file, and then using the paths from a play list file to find the tracks and grab the info, that way all your music doesn’t have to be in the place of the program.

It’s just a simple change of dbOut.write(String) in the JMDB class.

Read full topic

item.title: JMDB - Music database writer
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Unhandled:

Why is having an XML file listing your music useful?

Parsing the XML with PHP (making a web page), seeing an overview of your music, could be implemented in another program (a media player), etc.

Read full topic

item.title: JMDB - Music database writer
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Well, today I got bored and felt like making an organized database of my music. I ended up using http://javamusictag.sourceforge.net/, a open-source Java utility that parses ID3 tags from MP3 files to grab information of multiple files in a directory and add it to various arrays. After that, the program outputs and XML of all information in the arrays.

Example:

[user@COSMOS JMDB]$ ls
bin  Dominate.mp3  Downbeat clique.mp3  Sabbath Bloody Sabbath.mp3  src

After execution:

[user@COSMOS JMDB]$ ls
bin  database.xml  Dominate.mp3  Downbeat clique.mp3  Sabbath Bloody Sabbath.mp3  src

Contents of database.xml:

<?xml version="1.0"?> Morbid Angel Dominate Domination Dominate.mp3 Napalm Death Downbeat clique Time Waits For No Slave Downbeat clique.mp3 Anthrax Sabbath Bloody Sabbath I'm The Man [Ep] Sabbath Bloody Sabbath.mp3

Of course, items can be added to the database without re-writing it.

Read full topic
